result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
MAY TRANSFER TO PORTAGE COUNTY.

IF AFTER 12 MONTHS THE DEFENDANT HAS PAID THE RESTITUTION AND SURCHARGE IN FULL AND HAS HAD NO CRIMINAL VIOLATIONS, THE DEFENDANT MAY PETITION THE COURT FOR EARLY TERMINATION OF PROBATION

miscConds.notes: COMPLY WITH ANY AND ALL COUNSELING RECOMMENDED BY AGENT.

timeConds.notes: STAYED WITH CONDITIONS FOR ONE YEAR. IF RESTITUTION AND SURCHARGE ARE PAID IN FULL WITHIN 1 YEAR, THE DEFENDANT WILL NOT HAVE TO SERVE THE 90 DAY JAIL SENTENCE. IF IT IS NOT PAID WITHIN 1 YEAR, THE STAY WILL BE LIFTED AND THE DEFENDANT WOULD BE TAKEN INTO CUSTODY TO SERVE THAT 90 DAY SENTENCE

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Billy J. Davis in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Hendee does not object to early termination after one year if all fines and costs along with Restitution is paid in full.  Atty Zamzow agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.

Atty Zamzow makes sentencing arguments.  Atty Zamzow asks that Probation be transferred to Portage County and asks that the Court Costs be collected through Probation.

BY THE COURT:  Counts 1 & 2:  Withhold Sentence; 24 months Probation with conditions:
On Ct. 1:  Court orders 90 days in the Marquette County Jail; stayed with conditions:  If Restitution and Surcharge are paid in full within 1 year, the defendant will not have to serve the 90 day jail sentence.  If it is not paid within 1 year, the stay would be lifted and the defendant would be taken into custody to serve that 90 day sentence.
Restitution = $908.55 + 10% Surcharge = $999.41
Court Costs = $243.00 on each count (May be collected through the Agent)
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
May transfer Probation to Portage County

  If after 12 months the defendant has paid the Restitution and Surcharge in full and has had no criminal violations, the defendant may petition the court for early termination of Probation.

Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Zamzow asks for a plea/sentencing date.

BY THE COURT:  Set plea date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Prior: 430 E Division St, % Waushara County Jail, Wautoma, WI 54982 United States
warrant quashed at the request of defense attorney.

with conditions:
*Appear for booking by the next court date

Attorney Jeanne L. Zamzow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Zamzow states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Zamzow enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Court finds probable cause.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.
Atty Zamzow has no objection.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking by the next court date

Atty Zamzow states that the defendant is in Waushara County and his sentencing is Nov. 3rd; Atty Zamzow asks that the warrant be lifted.
BY THE COURT:  Warrant will be quashed.  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
